templates.name: The Great Gatsby
templates.description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald set in the 1920s, depicting the glamour and excess of the Jazz Age.

templates.name: To Kill Mock
templates.description: Harper Lee's classic tale of racial injustice, moral growth, and compassion in the American South.

templates.name: Pride and Prejudice
templates.description: Jane Austen's romantic comedy explores the societal expectations and love in early 19th-century England.
George Orwell's dystopian novel explores themes of surveillance, government oppression, and individual freedom.

templates.name: The Catcher in Rye
templates.description: J.D. Salinger's novel follows the disillusioned Holden Caulfield as he navigates adolescence and society.

templates.name: The Lord of Rings
templates.description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy follows the journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron.

templates.name: Animal Farm
templates.description: Orwell's allegorical novella explores political corruption, power dynamics, and the dangers of totalitarianism.

templates.name: Brave New World
templates.description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel depicts a society controlled by technology, social engineering, and conformity.

templates.name: The Hobbit
templates.description: Tolkien's adventure follows Bilbo Baggins as he joins a quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

templates.name: Harry Potter
templates.description: J.K. Rowling's debut novel introduces the magical world of Harry Potter and his journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
